ObjectStates.Name: Checker_red
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
function onSpawn()

    -- Create zones for the two players

    P1_ZONE = spawnObject({
        type = "ScriptingTrigger",
        position = {0.00, 3.51, -13.00},
        scale = {88.00, 5.10, 26.00},
        sound = false
    })

    P2_ZONE = spawnObject({
        type = "ScriptingTrigger",
        position = {0.00, 3.51, 13.00},
        scale = {88.00, 5.10, 26.00},
        sound = false
    })
end


function startGame()

    -- Find a card to start the deck

    for i, obj in ipairs(P1_ZONE.getObjects()) do
        if obj.type == "Deck" or obj.type == "Card" then
            deck1 = obj
            break
        end
    end

    for i, obj in ipairs(P2_ZONE.getObjects()) do
        if obj.type == "Deck" or obj.type == "Card" then
            deck2 = obj
            break
        end
    end


    -- Add all of the first player's cards from the table

    for i, obj in ipairs(P1_ZONE.getObjects()) do
        if obj ~= deck1 and (obj.type == "Deck" or obj.type == "Card") then
            deck1 = obj.putObject(deck1)
        end
    end


    -- Add all of the second player's cards from the table

    for i, obj in ipairs(P2_ZONE.getObjects()) do
        if obj ~= deck2 and (obj.type == "Deck" or obj.type == "Card") then
            deck2 = obj.putObject(deck2)
        end
    end


    -- Add all of the first player's cards from their hand

    for i, obj in ipairs(Player["Brown"].getHandObjects()) do
        deck1 = obj.putObject(deck1)
    end


    -- Add all of the second player's cards from their hand

    for i, obj in ipairs(Player["Teal"].getHandObjects()) do
        deck2 = obj.putObject(deck2)
    end


    -- Shuffle each player's deck

    deck1.randomize()
    deck2.randomize()
    

    -- Lay out the cards for each player

    deck1.setPosition(Vector(-12, 1, -8))
    deck1.setRotation(Vector(0, 180, 180))

    deck2.setPosition(Vector(-12, 1, 8))
    deck2.setRotation(Vector(0, 0, 180))

    for i = 1,5 do
        deck1.takeObject({position={-9 + 3*i, 1, -8}})
        deck2.takeObject({position={-9 + 3*i, 1, 8}})
    end


    -- Deal out five cards for each player

    Wait.frames(
        function()
            deck1.deal(5, "Brown")
            deck2.deal(5, "Teal")
        end,
        30
    )
end
ObjectStates.XmlUI:
<Button
    onClick = "startGame"
    position = "0 0 -30"
    width = "1200"
    height = "400"
    fontsize = "144">
    
    Start Game

</Button>
